meanings.definition: A very large molecule, such as a protein or nucleic acid, consisting of many smaller subunits.
meanings.sent1: The macromolecule in the cell helps carry out important functions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study macromolecules to understand how cells work.
meanings.sent3: The macromolecule and the tiny molecule had a dance-off in the laboratory.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a macromolecule, connecting ideas in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The macromolecule resembled a bustling city, with each subunit playing a unique role.
